radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked gallbladder wall thickening and edema with a large calcified gallstone impacted in the gallbladder neck (20 mm in diameter). Mild intrahepatic peribiliary edema is most likely reactive. No significant pericholecystic stranding. Visualized lungs are within normal limits. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. Normal findings in other abdominal organs (liver, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, gastrointestinal tract, pelvis, and reproductive organs). Lymph node adjacent to the gallbladder measures 10 mm in short axis. No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
